intro: Cymopterus tenuifolius, commonly known as the slenderleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and disturbed areas. Cymopterus tenuifolius is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access moisture.
